section.section: A vice president or program director may suspend a classified employee without pay pending disposition of a charge for removal.
The vice president or program director shall notify the classified employee in writing of the suspension and the reasons for it.

text.section: Within 5 workdays after receiving a notice of suspension under this section, a classified employee may request in writing that the President conduct a preliminary hearing to determine whether the employee may continue to work with pay pending disposition of the charge.
The President shall hold the preliminary hearing within 5 workdays after the President receives the request.

section.section: A preliminary hearing under this subtitle is in addition to the hearing on the merits required by § 14-205 of this subtitle.

The preliminary hearing is limited to the following issues:
Whether suspension without pay is necessary to protect the interests of the University or of the classified employee pending final disposition of the charge; and
Whether other employment and status alternatives for the classified employee should be considered.

text.section:
At the preliminary hearing, the classified employee may:
Rebut the reasons given for the suspension;
Assert mitigating circumstances; and
Offer alternatives to the suspension, including:
A return to the employee's position with pay;
A transfer to another position with pay; or
A suspension with pay.

section.section: Within 5 workdays after the preliminary hearing, the President shall issue a proposed decision in writing for approval by the Secretary of Budget and Management.
The decision is conclusive only as to the issue of the suspension.
